title: Martin Keown tells Mesut Ozil how to save his Arsenal career after Unai Emery snubs
text:
Mesut Ozil is being sidelined by Unai Emery at Arsenal (Picture: Getty)

Martin Keown has told Mesut Ozil that only hard graft will win over Unai Emery and save his career at Arsenal.

German playmaker Ozil has made over 230 appearances for Arsenal since signing from Real Madrid in the summer of 2013.

His influence has waned under current manager Emery, however, and the Gunners boss has given Ozil just two starts so far this season, often leaving him out of his matchday squad altogether.

Keown says it is ‘disappointing’ that a player of Ozil’s class is being sidelined and insists the only way he can save his Arsenal career is through hard work.

Emery has only started Ozil twice this season (Picture: Getty)

‘I think it’s disappointing that someone with that amount of talent can’t find his way into an Arsenal team,’ Gunners legend Keown said.

‘And again, that’s about balance. That’s about a player wanting to graft and show the other side of his game. Until he does that, he won’t be in this new Arsenal team.’

Under Emery, the Gunners have enjoyed a promising start to the 2019-20 season and currently sit third in the Premier League, one point below defending champions Manchester City.

Keown, who played under legendary manager Arsene Wenger, believes Emery has ‘the tools’ to become a success at the Emirates and get the club back into the Champions League.

‘I’m not close enough to Emery to know how charismatic he is, what personality he has,’ the former England defender added.

‘He strikes me as being a thoroughly good guy, which is a good starting place. I think Emery’s the right man to turn it round.

‘He’s had a good year now and I expect it to really pick up for the rest of the season.

‘As long as the players take everything on board, and there’s clear messages to the players, I think he has the tools to be successful.

‘Maybe it goes over to the manager now, the pressure’s on him to get the right balance, pick the right players, get behind them and put Arsenal back in the Champions League.’
